page.title: 05AREA BORDERING E.COVENTRY
page.content: The{M6}marks the boundary between the suburban area of{Potters Green - {Walsgrave}and the adjacent rural area.The landscape is fairly flat with the pattern broken up by scattered small copses and tiny ponds.This is an area of varied agriculture with{sheep {cattle}and{crops}. The only population concentration is the small village of{Barnacle}.Despite its close proximity to Coventry and Bedworth,this area appears very quiet,evoking a sharp contrast with the heavily populated and industrialised centres to the west and north.The presence of the {motorways,Oxford Canal}and{A46}also leave Barnacle virtually untouched. There is a garden centre,kennels and scrapyard,a small garage and a vehicle recovery firm.
